sentences.en: ...a small, quaint town with narrow streets and traditional half-timbered houses.
sentences.cn: …一座古朴的小镇，有着狭窄的街道和传统的半木制房屋。

sentences.en: a quaint little village in Yorkshire
sentences.cn: 约克郡一个古色古香的小村庄

sentences.en: Carrie scowled. The effect was something so quaint and droll it caught even the manager.
sentences.cn: 嘉莉做出愁眉苦脸的样子.效果十分奇妙而可笑,连经理也被吸引住了.

sentences.en: Grandma lives in a quaint old cottage.
sentences.cn: 奶奶住在一栋古色古香的乡间别墅里.

sentences.en: He saw them as quaint, or innocent, or touching.
sentences.cn: 他会认为他们这些人或者离奇古怪, 或者洁白无瑕, 或者使人伤怀.

sentences.en: Here was an old church, quaint and rambling and gabled.
sentences.cn: 这儿有一座古老的教堂, 样子古雅,显得零乱,是带山墙的建筑.

sentences.en: His ideas were quaint and fantastic . She brought him judiciously to earth.
sentences.cn: 他的看法荒廖古怪,她颇有见识地劝他面对现实.

sentences.en: I liked Nina, too; she was so quaint and unexpected.
sentences.cn: 我也很喜欢尼娜; 她是那样离奇有趣,不可捉摸.

sentences.en: Over the parapet showed quaint and fanciful little buildings.
sentences.cn: 栏杆里有一些古雅精致的小建筑物.

sentences.en: The piano has a quaint old - world tone about it.
sentences.cn: 这架钢琴的音色具有一种古雅的 老式 风味.

sentences.en: The quaint Persian city has been engulfed by a roaring metropolis.
sentences.cn: 那富有奇趣的波斯城市已经被一座喧嚣的大都会所吞没.

sentences.en: There were many small lanes in the quaint village.
sentences.cn: 在这古香古色的村庄里,有很多小巷.

sentences.en: They lived in a quaint little house.
sentences.cn: 他们住在一幢老式而别致的小房子里.

sentences.en: They still keep some quaint old customs.
sentences.cn: 他们仍然保留着一些稀奇古怪的旧风俗.

sentences.en: Those whom Nature had depicted as merely quaint became grotesque.
sentences.cn: 本来只可以说有一点奇异的东西,现在都变得光怪陆离.

sentences.en: To Philip the room seemed quaint and charming.
sentences.cn: 菲利浦觉得这房间既典雅又迷人.

words.tran_cn: 离奇有趣地；古雅地；优雅地

trans.tran_cn: 古色古香的，少见的，古怪的，离奇有趣的，做得精巧的
trans.tran_en: unusual and attractive, especially in an old-fashioned way
